comments.body: this is O(N) which seems bad (consider lists that have thousands of items)

I agree that it's possible, when we have scrolling popup menus, for lists to have thousands of items.  I'll file an issue about addressing this. 

See #2202
please use constants for the values in this method
maybe assert that the value isn't null if the item is enabled?
That sounds like a good mistake catcher.  Will do.
Well I guess the PopupMenuEntryState would be a bit more complex. It has to introduce the InkWell. The onTap handler would be in there too.
Yeah, given this, I don't think it's worth trying to be clever with the State object. It would only be used by the Divider.
when you add code like this, add trailing commas :-)

comments.body: Could you explain why you need to add `(size.height - position.top - position.bottom) / 2.0` to the top offset? It makes my popup menu showing at a wrong place...
If you're seeing a problem with popup menus, please open a new issue and include a small test case that demos the problem. Happy to take a look!
